posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
The raiders lined the boys up in the center of the little village, in front of where the cooking pots hung over burned out fire pits.  Surrounded by the charred remains of the huts and hovels - and the hacked up bodies of the parents and families of the boys - the raiders went through their selection process.  The village girls had already been distributed as spoils to the Captains, to serve in their households (and, later, when they were older, their beds) as slaves.  The boys were different, however.  Only the boys who were worthy would survive.

"Kang na mitha," ordered the patrol leader.  Each of the boys was given a small axe.  There were 12 boys in total, all hungry, thirsty and scared.  They were in pairs, each with a boy of similar age and size.  

"Who wants food?", thundered the patrol leader.  All of the boys raised their hands    

"If you want to eat, food is here.  All you have to do is kill the boy who is next to you and you will get food!"

The boys trembled and looked about.  They were young - most barely old enough to help with chores like finding kindling sticks or picking sai berries.  They were in disbelief hearing the words of the raider.

"Kill him!"  The raider ordered the first boy in line, pointing to the child next to him.  Both boys teared up, one shaking and the other wetting himself.  The raider swung his sword and took the heads of both boys in one arc.

The raider moved to the next pair of boys.  "Kill him!", he roared.  The two boys blubbered and dropped their axes.  The raider took their heads, too.

He moved to the next pair of boys.  "Kill him!", he hissed.  Little Cobbin, stood there, shaking & sobbing.  Next to him, Donol looked at the raider, took his axe and buried it in the side of Cobbin's face.

"Good!  We have one," said the patrol leader.  "Dispose of the others."  

The raiders slew the last six boys and took Donol with them to be raised as a Dayo. Donol was 5 years old.

That was nearly three decades ago.  Donol was a Dayo now.  Not merely a Dayo but a Captain of Captains of the Dayo.  He came up through the ranks, learning very quickly how to become an efficient and deadly killer.  His people were physically gifted, so as he grew into his size and strength, he gained the notice of the War Leader.  Alone and unaided, Donol slipped into the impenetrable fortress of the hated Kai Nang and assassinated their Prince Regent.  Donol slew thousands with his war axe and prevailed in single combat a dozen times over the champions of other armies.  After all of that and other dazzling displays of prowess on the battlefield and utter ruthlessness in the accomplishment of his duties, he stood now as the Roko ni Katan - the Champion of the Dayo.   

Donol no longer remembers anything about the village . . . except for the sight of his hand axe going into Cobbin's head.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Good fanfic story, TF!

Moving toward a better build, choose ONE of these three options, listed in order of decreasing impact:

1) Blind Fight - pretty much a prereq for melee, ask any shadow or user of Imp Invis
2) Exotic/WF: Dwf Waraxe - the highest damage 1H weapon available (dependent on availability naturally, but the thing rox!)
3) SkF: Intimidate - Boost TR DC by 3.  Unfortunately, though I see no TR feat selection listed so plug that in or dump most of the skill.

Any one of these alternatives cost the paltry investment into the +2 Fort feat. Your primary save is fine "as is".  TBH, there are usually enhancements available that make Will saves unnecessary (i.e. Immunity to fear, mind-control) but seldom any that help avoid all that damage from fireballs and most all other evocation threats.  I'd be more concerned with the low reflex myself because it is more common.

I realize your intent was to race to DevCrit as quickly as possible. Good instincts. However, this is neither an RDD nor WM build hence the AB is somewhat low-end for DevCrit.  In a case like that, the most important factor is boosting AB quickly.  "You can't crit if you can't hit!"

Make sure to post applicable alignment restrictions... this one is any non-lawful evil toon.

Now for a friendly nudge...

Please, please... post only finalized, fully-tested builds in the Finished Builds subforums.  If you are looking for input, please post untested builds along with the Build Requests. The intent has always been to allow players to bring up a build that is ready-to-go to save them the trouble of sanitizing it themselves before playing.  There will often be input from the guild to help it work better, but those comments are typically refinements rather than correcting major gaffes.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Looking pretty good now, TF.  Nice damage. Good work and thanks for sticking with it! ;)

I never liked Whirlwind or Great Cleave myself.  Since it's part of a DevCrit build you have little choice but both those continuation feats have a tendency to lock your animation and get you pounded really bad with no recourse.  Unless there is someone out there who knows the trick of breaking out of a Great Cleave domino lock?  I'm referring to server play here.  No pausing techniques are valid.  I've never been able to myself so ditched all the DevCrit builds I owned unless the toon's AC, DR & SR is so high they can afford to flail endlessly while those casters and archers in the periphery pretty much have their way with the maniac ~or~ was a DevCrit archer who can never trigger cleave in the first place.

The way I usually decide how long to delay BF is by virtue of knowledge of the content.  If I'm not facing concealed types (and I mean stealthers as well as skin % conceal), I can postpone it until late into pre-epic like you have.  However, when I played WoG, I always took it at level 1 because every bleedin' creature on the server HIDES!  It becomes significantly more important for a dexer than one like this so I'd just plan on when you figure those skin conceals could cheap shot me in the areas to be explorered and make sure I had it by then.
